intro: Tripinnaria africana, commonly known as the African tripinnaria, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows as a shrub, reaching heights of up to 1 meter, with narrow, gray-green leaves. Its flowers are yellow and arranged in dense, flat-topped clusters, making it an attractive ornamental plant. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or coastal areas.
